Ipswich County Library

Manager: Marion Harvey

Northgate Street, Ipswich
IP1 3DE

Tel: 01473 263810
Email: help@suffolklibraries.co.uk
Friends group: Friends of Ipswich County Library
Newsletter: Sign up

Social media:

  • Facebook
  • Twitter
  • Instagram

Branch facilities

  • Accessibility information
  • Payments: cash, cheques and cards accepted
  • Special collections: African Caribbean resources, Indic language resources, Music & drama library
  • Out-of-hours book return available
  • Customer toilet
  • Display space: Double sided display case available for hire - please book 2 weeks in advance

IT and printing facilities

  • Free wifi
  • Book a computer
  • Borrow a BBC micro:bit
  • Photocopying: available
  • Colour printing: available
  • Fax
  • Printing, photocopying & scanning charges

Room and space hire

Monday 0900 – 1800
Tuesday 0900 – 1900
Wednesday 0900 – 1800
Thursday 0900 – 1800
Friday 0900 – 1900
Saturday 0830 – 1700
Sunday 1000 – 1600

Regular events and activities

Children's events

Baby bounce: soothing songs and gentle nursery rhymes for babies (term time only)

Wednesday, 1415-1445

Chess club for 6-16 year olds

Saturday, 1000-1130

Children’s craft activities

Sunday, 1030-1130

Minecraft group for ages 6-12: bring your own devices

Tuesday, 1545-1645

Play, rhyme and storytime for young children

Thursday, 1030-1115

Tot Rock: songs and action rhymes for toddlers (term time only) – drop-in

Wednesday, 1015-1045

Older people's events

Top Time: events and activities for older people

Thursday, 1430-1600

Reading groups

BooksFizz reading group: 50p for hot drinks and biscuits

last Wednesday of the month, 1400-1500

IT help

Internet training sessions with Lxpert - £15 for a three-part course

Tuesdays 10, 24 and 31 October, 1400-1500

Language courses

Chat and Chill: group for women who speak English as an additional language

Monday, 1000-1200

Chat and Chill: group for women who speak English as an additional language

Thursday, 1000-1200

Chat and Chill: group for women who speak English as an additional language

Tuesday, 1000-1200

Conversation cafe: drop in and improve your English speaking and listening skills with the help of native and fluent English speakers. 50p including a coffee or tea and a biscuit

Friday every 2 weeks, 1000-1200

Arts, crafts & games

Board Games Library: borrow a board game to play in the library (£1) or at home (£1-£3), or a children's board game to play in the library (free). Available from the ground floor desk. Donations of good-quality board games appreciated.

Every day, All day

Inside the lines: adult colouring group – held in the Hub, £1 a session

Tuesday, 1030-1130

Health & wellbeing events

Keep Fit - £25 for 6 classes, fitness conditioning, all levels welcome, bring a towel/exercise mat and bottle of water, please book in advance

Friday, 1745-1845

Lifting Spirits with Suffolk Family Carers - women's singing project for carers - speak to your Suffolk Family Carers contact if you require respite care to attend

every other Monday, 1920-2120

Music in Mind with Suffolk Family Carers - singing for family carers, with a mental health focus - speak to your Suffolk Family Carers contact if you require respite care to attend

every other Monday, 1400-1600

New Age Kurling

Friday, 1000-1300

Open space: drop in for health info and chats. All welcome. See the latest Ipswich Open Space timetable.

Wednesday, 1300-1500

Slimming World: held in the lecture hall

Thursday, 0930-1130

Slimming World: held in the lecture hall

Thursday, 1200-1330

Councillor surgeries & professional advice

New Anglia Growth Hub free business advice in the Hub: book in advance

sessions arranged on a mutually convenient basis, N/A

Fundraising, stalls & book sales

Craft sale - to reserve a table, email a completed booking form (.doc) to ipswich.library@suffolklibraries.co.uk and see our Terms and Conditions (PDF) and Code of Conduct (PDF).

third Thursday of the month, 1000-1600

Table top sale - to reserve a table, email a completed booking form (.doc) to ipswich.library@suffolklibraries.co.uk and see our Terms and Conditions (PDF) and Code of Conduct (PDF).

first Saturday of the month, 1000-1600

Privacy & cookies

By using our site you agree to our use of cookies. Find out what cookies we use, how they affect you and how you can control them: our cookie policy.
